results.title: Outward Bound - the Challenge
results.brief_description: Part 1(a) “The Challenge”. Two participants are followed through the 26 day Outward Bound Standard Course. They experience caving, expeditioning, rock climbing, rafting, canoeing, group tasks, navigation, abseiling, exploration and self discovery. Both the challenge and the personal development changes they encounter during this adventure into self-understanding are skilfully captured on film. Part 1(b) “Other Courses”. An exciting overview of all Outward Bound programs. Part 2: Interview with the Executive Director.

results.title: Big night out
results.brief_description: Wilbur Wilde and Kerry Simpson feature in this rap cartoon addressing the importance of not sharing needles and how to correctly clean them. Using animated and studio footage the story revolves around a party where the issue of safe needle use arises. “Big Night Out” provides safe use messages (ie: cleaning injecting equipment effectively and where to get new needles and syringes) via the Streetwise cartoon character, Dr Klevadik. The language utilised within the video is “street based” in order to increase target group acceptance. Aims to provide safe messages regarding intravenous drug use and potential HIV and HepB transmission.

results.title: Macedonia
results.creator_credit: Giorgos Zervoulakos and General Secretariat of Press and Information of Greece
results.brief_description: A history of Greek Macedonia from prehistoric times to the 19th Century. It covers the relationship between Macedonia and early Greece, the life of the greatest of all Macedonians, Alexander the Great, the Ottoman invasion and longterm occupation by the Turks and the 19th Century resistance to the invaders. It also retells the Greek myths and sources of contemporary folk dances in Macedonia.

results.title: Zoo Family. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Chris Sheil, Howard Neil and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at the Melbourne Zoological Gardens and each adventure revolves around the Mitchell family who live in the zoo. Dr Mitchell is the zoo vet and his children Nick and Susie help out. The real stars however are the animals who feature throughout.

results.brief_description: Zoo Family was filmed on location at the Melbourne Zoological Gardens and each adventure revolves around the zoo vet and his children, Susie and Nick who manage to get into all sorts of adventures. However it is the animals who are the real stars of the film.

results.title: Let the balloon go (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Set in a small Australian outback town in 1917, this is the story of a young boy who is determined to fight against the limitations imposed upon him because of his physical disabilities.

results.title: James Galway Program 5
results.brief_description: James Galway introduces the cellist Julian Lloyd Webber, with Peter Pettinger on piano to perform “Arioso in G” by Bach, “Schezzetto” by Bridge, “Elegaic” by Faure, “Gavotte No 2” by Popper, “In the Holy Light” by W Lloyd Webber, and “Ritual Fire Dance” by Manuel de Falla. Rated: G

results.title: James Galway Program 4
results.brief_description: Siner, Maureen Braithwaite is introduced by James Galway, flautist, and joined by percussionist, Evelyn Glennie and clarinettist, Emma Johnson, to perform “Danse Macabre” (sung) by Saint Saens, “Sonata Finale” by Poulenc, “Donde Leiter” from “La Boheme” by Puccini, “Study on Black Keys” by Chopin, “Jeannie with the Light Brown Hair”, “Tambourin Chinois” by Kriesler, “Summertime” by Gershwin. Rated: G

results.title: Sailing the Greek Isles
results.brief_description: Join Scott Lambert and three other Australians, along with a Greek skipper, for a month among the beautiful Greek Islands. Visit the island of Mykonos with its wonderful Cubist architecture, Rhodes with its castles of the Knights of St John built over 500 years ago, Siftos and Santorini. Legend has it that Santorini, the island on the rim of a giant volcanic crater, and believed to be the home of vampires, is the site of the lost city of Atlantis. Then travel with the group to Turkey, home of the traditional enemies of the Greeks, and visit Effasis the second largest city of the Roman Empire, and then on to see the reputed house of the Virgin Mary.
